node.title: A poll, a putsch and a pandemic. One unexpected year reporting from the US
node.alt: Night shot of man standing in front of lawn of US flags in front of the Capitol Building.
node.description: Returning home from 12 months in Washington, Greg Jennett reflects on the big stories and the United States' constant capacity to surprise.
node.content:
["First in the tens, then by the dozens, car horns blared through the downtown streets of Detroit.", "Mid-morning in the mid-west, the city was stirring to a spontaneous peoples' movement \u2014\u00a0sort of apt that it was car-borne in \"Motown\".", "The rolling commotion seeped through the double plate-glass windows nine storeys above, loud enough that an extra click or two was needed on the volume of the TV remote.", "At 11:40am on Saturday, November 7, America's tense four-day wait for a result from its historic 2020 election was suddenly over.", "Soon, its wild, four-year ride through the Trump presidency was finished.", "\"Joe Biden elected 46th US president,\" the news flashed on screens and phones once every major national media organisation in the land announced\u00a0that the then-77-year-old had won the state of Pennsylvania and, with it, the race to the White House.", "Anticipating the result \u2014\u00a0a 50\u201350 call in a two-horse race \u2014\u00a0our very small ABC News team including digital reporter Emily Clark, cameraman Tom Hancock and I had gone to Michigan to piece together at least a small slice of the story of \"how the mid-west was won\"\u00a0for Biden.", "Now that victory seemed to be secured, peacefully that day, we headed back to base in Washington DC.", "", "
Crowds swell outside the White House to celebrate Biden-Harris win.
", "What had started in Detroit with honking car horns six\u00a0hours earlier\u00a0escalated into a full-blown street party by the time we reached the capital that afternoon.", "The exuberant \"f***Trump\"\u00a0chants rang out late into the night in this little pocket of fervent anti-Trump sentiment, especially outside the fenced-off Lafayette Park at 16th Street which had been locked to the public for almost three months since the summer's angry Black Lives Matter protests.", "Trump did and said little that night, except offering a late-night, all caps Tweet exclaiming \"BAD THINGS HAPPENED\" in relation to the conduct of the poll, to which Twitter slapped the obligatory caveat:\u00a0\"This claim about election fraud is disputed.\"", "Heading home some time after midnight, it was one of those occasions to stop and reflect on what the larger ABC team had witnessed and to wonder whether our first drafts had done justice to this historic day.", "As a reporter, truly momentous news stories like these normally only come around every few years or so and, in my case, had included suitably spaced events including the wrenching political leadership coups in Canberra, the executions of Australian drug smugglers in Indonesia and, more recently, Hong Kong's last-gasp protests against Beijing's clampdown on legal freedoms.", "Somehow, through its constant capacity to surprise, America would throw more\u00a0at the ABC's news team in the US at regular intervals in the 12 months that followed.", "
Stay \u2013 just a little bit longer
", "A week or so before the November 3 election, I'd joined a COVID-reduced \"mini surge\"\u00a0of reporters and camera operators drawn from Australia and London to provide back-up, and a little relief afterwards, for local reporters David Lipson, Kathryn Diss and Philip Williams \u2013 all flogged by relentless campaign and protest coverage in the preceding months.", "", "
Greg Jennett was among the reporters navigating the COVID-19 social distancing rules in the White House press briefing room.(ABC News: Bradley McLennan)
", "Plans and staff turnover changed soon after the election result came through\u00a0and, considering the difficulties of moving people into the COVID-ravaged US with its 230,000 new cases a day, I found myself agreeing to stay for a year to fill a gap.", "A surprise to all at home in Canberra, it was more than I'd bargained for, yet produced a memorable year of coverage that exceeded all expectations.", "
Siege on the Hill
", "Sometimes it pays to expect the unexpected.", "In retrospect, there were probably enough warnings along the crowded National Mall on January 6 to have expected the mob wasn't going to leave Washington\u00a0meekly accepting Joe Biden's certification as the next president.", "", "
The ABC Washington team had been preparing for trouble on the streets but no-one anticipated the storming of the Capitol building.(ABC News: Kathryn Diss)
", "Even in the rally's\u00a0peaceful phase that morning, protestors from states near and far were seething with anger, spewing insults at anyone from the mainstream media, who they blamed for endorsing this \"rigged\"\u00a0election (asserted, always, without proof).", "Some hinted freely they may have been wearing holstered guns under their jackets in violation of local DC laws.", "Dressed in jackboots and tactical military garb, The Proud Boys glowered menacingly all day.", "Many books have already been written on all that followed, but anyone who worked that day, as correspondent Kathryn Diss and I did, hardly need them to remind us how closely America teetered towards a descent into a tin-pot democracy.", "The Capitol hadn't been breached so violently since 1814.", "", "
Greg Jennett (centre), camera operator Bradley McLennan and producer Chloe Ross cover\u00a0Joe Biden's inauguration.(ABC News: Bradley McLennan)
", "The massive security clampdown afterwards \u2014\u00a0including the deployment of the National Guard\u00a0and use of miles of razor wire and scale-proof fencing \u2014\u00a0belatedly demonstrated the determination of federal authorities to never let it happen again.", "It began the long march to a soulless Biden inauguration.", "Unique among presidential inaugurations, Joe Biden's first day on January 20, 2021, was a media-only affair held inside the heavily guarded steel cage that encased the mall, looking east to the Capitol.", "Where tens of thousands would normally stand to watch, only pre-screened, accredited media representatives could enter the mall and only after an epic drive across the river in Virginia, back into DC again and then a long hike into the secure zone to take up our vantage point.", "", "
Camera operator Bradley McLennan pushes\u00a0a\u00a0trolley of broadcasting equipment required for covering the Biden inauguration.(ABC News)
", "Understanding the logistics and the fact we only get one shot at moments like these, ABC camera operator Brad McLennan thankfully left nothing to chance, packing a weighty trolley load of lights, stands, batteries, spares and more \u2013 all great for capturing nice images, but a nightmare for hauling the two to three\u00a0kilometres down the southern perimeter of Washington's elongated steel cage for our coverage.", "
Beyond the capital
", "", "
Greg Jennett works in Minneapolis covering the conviction of former police officer Derek Chauvin over the death of George Floyd.(ABC News)
", "Just because the ABC's US bureau is located in Washington doesn't mean we report politics alone.", "In an eventful year, we tracked the rollout of more than 400 million COVID-19 vaccine shots, tennis champ Dylan Alcott's \"Golden\u00a0Slam\"\u00a0at the US Open and the opening leg of the corporate space race pitching Richard Branson against Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos.", "", "
Dylan Alcott celebrates\u00a0his US Open win.(ABC News)
", "As winter turned to spring and summer in 2021, the Washington team \u2014 including correspondents Barbara Miller and Sarah Ferguson, camera operator Cam Schwartz and digital reporter Emily Olson \u2014 covered the country's reopening, the resumption of full face-to-face schooling, Brittany Spears's legal tribulations and Tiger Woods's driving mishap in California \u2014 all supported by bureau producers Chloe Ross and Peter Jones.", "Along the way, there was a jury verdict on the killing that triggered a nationwide uproar and the Black Lives Matter movement in 2020.", "When policeman Derek Chauvin was finally convicted in September 2021, Brad McLennan captured the outpouring of emotion on the streets of Minneapolis, from the Hennepin County Courthouse to the suburban supermarket where George\u00a0Floyd had heaved his last breath.", "", "
Lights at Ground Zero in New York mark the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks.(ABC News: Bradley McLennan)
", "September 2021 brought the abrupt and disastrous end to America's longest war \u2014\u00a0in Afghanistan \u2014 and, in short order, the commemoration of the 9/11 terrorist attacks that started it in 2001.", "At Ground Zero in NYC, we encountered firefighters and businessmen for whom the loss was still felt as keenly today.", "In their endeavour to plan, produce and polish, modern news organisations don't always relish genuine surprises these days, but still must cope with them when they happen.", "The US\u00a0remains an unrivalled source of unanticipated news.", "There was the day Biden held his video hook-up with Scott Morrison and UK PM Boris Johnson with little notice to announce their AUKUS strategic alliance, and the beachside collapse of an apartment tower in Miami.", "From the moment the first images of the building disaster in Surfside emerged \u2014\u00a0the worst of its kind in US\u00a0history \u2014\u00a0it was clear the chances of survival were slim.", "", "
Greg Jennett working\u00a0at the scene of the Miami building collapse that killed 98 people.(ABC News: Bradley McLennan)
", "On a sleepless day of reporting and travelling for 24 hours, we scrambled to Miami and stayed there for days\u00a0until the rescue mission grimly transformed into a recovery operation and the media's ongoing presence felt unduly intrusive.", "Of course, these were only some of the stories covered in a year of tremendous professional opportunity.", "As all correspondents will attest, reporting from an overseas post is a privilege and a career highlight at any time \u2014\u00a0even more so at a time when international travel is impossible for most Australians.", "That the ABC was able to maintain its network of foreign bureaus\u00a0\u2014 despite the risks posed at the depth of the COVID-19 pandemic \u2014 was remarkable, due in no small part to the resilience and dedication of its teams in multiple countries and those running them from HQ in Sydney.", "", "
Camera operator Brad McLennan films\u00a0the US Capitol building, which was stormed by Trump supporters protesting against the presidential election result.(ABC News: Greg Jennett)
", "Compared to what so many Australians endured in 2020\u201321, Washington DC was certainly no hardship post.", "But any stresses we might have experienced in the US\u00a0were worth it, in the quiet satisfaction we were doing our bit to keep the international side of ABC News operations going in troubled times.", "Telling audiences the stories of America's achievements and its many imperfections when they couldn't experience it for themselves never felt more important.", "Well worth the extra stay."]
